DCA for SARS-CoV-2

Epistatic model predict SARS-CoV-2 mutability of proteins and epitopes

View the Project on GitHub GiancarloCroce/DCA_SARS-CoV-2

Epistatic model predict SARS-CoV-2 mutability of proteins and epitopes

For each site of the SARS-CoV-2 reference strain, Wuhan-Hu-1 (Accession NC_045512), we introduce a mutability score to predict SARS-CoV-2 mutable and constrained sites. Our modelization is based on the Direct Coupling Analysis model.

Predictions are validated using genomes of the SARS-CoV-2 strains from the GISAID database.

Paper: papername.

The results of the analysis for the whole proteome are available here as a .csv file.

The data structure is:

protein  domain	      position_protein  position_domain  aa_Wuhan-Hu-1  mutability_score(IND)  mutability_score(DCA)  observed_mut_Mar2021  observed_mut_Nov2020  observed_mut_Jul2020
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  349               1.0              S              -3.7992                -7.0714                0.0                   0.0                   0.0
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  350               2.0              V              -5.4405                -6.8487                1.0                   0.0                   0.0
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  351               3.0              Y              -4.9535                -7.4424                6.0                   1.0                   1.0
Spike    bCoV_S1_RBD  352               4.0              A              -2.7878                -6.6612                17.0                  3.0                   2.0

For the RDB domain, we also include IEDB site response frequency and corresponding 95% confidence interval upper/lowerbound.

protein  domain	      position_protein	... 	IEDB_upperbound  IEDB_lowerbound  IEDB_response_frequency
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  349             	... 	0.10             0.05             0.073563
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  350             	... 	0.10             0.05             0.069284
Spike  	 bCoV_S1_RBD  351             	... 	0.11             0.06             0.083333
Spike    bCoV_S1_RBD  352             	... 	0.10             0.05             0.069212

A Jupyter-notebook to analyse the data and to reproduce the paper results is available here.
